intro: Disandra, commonly known as the "false mallow," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and the Americas. The plants typically have palmate leaves and produce showy, often pink or red, flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Disandra species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and attractive foliage. Some species are also used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
